Key Match Events: Christian Bethancourt drove in seven runs, including a go-ahead two-run single in the ninth
Pete Crow-Armstrong had a career-high four hits
Ian Happ chipped in three hits
Porter Hodge pitched two scoreless innings to become the unlikely winner
Paul Skenes gave up three runs, two earned, over the first two innings
Bryan Reynolds and Connor Joe both homered and finished with three hits
Rowdy Tellez also had three hits
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs trailed by seven through six innings before taking advantage of another shaky performance by Pittsburgh's bullpen
Pirates manager Derek Shelton fumed after the collapse, admitting 'I don’t know if I’ve been as (angry) as I am right now.'
Post-Match Reflections: The Cubs improved to 17-8 over their last 25 games to move two games above.500 (68-66) for the first time since May 25 and stay on the fringe of contention for a wild-card playoff spot.
Pirates manager Derek Shelton fumed after the collapse, admitting 'I don’t know if I’ve been as (angry) as I am right now.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Christian Bethancourt hit a two-run homer in the seventh to start Chicago's surge
The catcher added a two-run double in the eighth
Bryan Reynolds and Connor Joe both homered and finished with three hits
Rowdy Tellez also had three hits
Porter Hodge pitched two scoreless innings to become the unlikely winner
Cruz easily handled a fly ball in the sixth but was charged with a questionable throwing error when he unleashed a 103.3 mph throw home on a single by Crow-Armstrong
Others: Ben Brown (neck strain) is unlikely to return this season
Andrew McCutchen (knee) has resumed all baseball activities and could return this weekend
Ke'Bryan Hayes has had multiple doctors look at his lower back, with no definitive diagnosis
The Cubs will start a three-game set against the Nationals on Friday
The Pirates will be off Thursday, then head to Cleveland to begin a three-game interleague series with the skidding Guardians on Friday
